name: Marketing & Communications
description: Prompts for marketing professionals, content creators, and communications specialists in New Zealand

prompts.title: Content Calendar Generator
prompts.content:
Create a content calendar for [Brand/Company Name] for [Time Period].

Brand: [Brand Name]
Industry: [Industry]
Target Audience: [Audience Description]

Marketing Goals:
[List Goals]

Content Pillars:
[List 3-5 Content Themes]

Channels:
[List Channels - Blog, LinkedIn, Instagram, etc.]

Upcoming Events/Dates:
- NZ Public Holidays
- Industry events
- Product launches
[List Specific Dates]

Generate a calendar including:
1. Weekly content themes
2. Post frequency per channel
3. Content type mix
4. Key dates and tie-ins
5. Resource requirements
6. Engagement prompts

prompts.title: Campaign Brief Template
prompts.content:
Develop a comprehensive campaign brief for [Campaign Name].

Client/Brand: [Brand Name]
Campaign Type: [Awareness/Launch/Seasonal/etc.]
Budget: [Budget in NZD]
Timeline: [Start - End Dates]

Objectives:
[List SMART Objectives]

Target Audience:
- Demographics: [Demographics]
- Psychographics: [Interests, Values]
- NZ-specific: [Regional Considerations]

Key Message:
[Core Message]

Competitive Context:
[Competitor Activity]

Create a brief covering:
1. Campaign overview
2. Target audience personas
3. Key messages and tone
4. Channel strategy
5. Creative requirements
6. Success metrics and KPIs
7. Timeline and milestones
8. Budget allocation

prompts.title: Social Media Post Generator
prompts.content:
Create social media posts for [Topic/Product/Event].

Brand: [Brand Name]
Brand Voice: [Describe Voice - Professional/Casual/Witty/etc.]
Platform: [LinkedIn/Instagram/Facebook/Twitter]

Topic: [Topic Details]

Call to Action: [Desired CTA]

Hashtag Strategy: [Branded/Industry/Trending]

NZ Context: [Any NZ-specific elements to include]

Generate:
1. Primary post with copy and emoji suggestions
2. Two alternative versions
3. Hashtag recommendations
4. Best posting times for NZ audience
5. Engagement question for comments
6. Image/video direction suggestions

prompts.title: Marketing Performance Report
prompts.content:
Create a marketing performance report for [Period].

Company: [Company Name]
Reporting Period: [Dates]

Channels to Report:
[List Active Channels]

Metrics Available:
- Website: [Traffic, Conversions, etc.]
- Social: [Followers, Engagement, etc.]
- Email: [Open Rate, CTR, etc.]
- Paid: [Spend, ROAS, etc.]

Campaigns Run:
[List Campaigns]

Budget Spent: [Amount]

Generate a report including:
1. Executive summary
2. Channel-by-channel performance
3. Campaign analysis
4. Top performing content
5. ROI analysis
6. NZ market insights
7. Recommendations for next period
8. Visual dashboard suggestions

prompts.title: Press Release Template
prompts.content:
Write a press release for [Announcement Type].

Company: [Company Name]
Headquarters: [NZ Location]
Announcement: [What is Being Announced]

Key Details:
- What: [Description]
- When: [Date/Timeline]
- Who: [People Involved]
- Why: [Significance]

Quotes from:
- [Name, Title]: [Key Message]

Supporting Information:
[Background, Statistics, Context]

NZ Media Considerations:
[Relevant NZ Angle]

Create a press release with:
1. Compelling headline
2. Subheadline
3. Dateline and lead paragraph
4. Body with quotes
5. Boilerplate about the company
6. Media contact information
7. Notes to editor if applicable

prompts.title: Brand Voice Guidelines
prompts.content:
Develop brand voice guidelines for [Brand Name].

Company: [Company Name]
Industry: [Industry]
Target Audience: [Primary Audience]

Brand Values:
[List Core Values]

Brand Personality:
[Describe Personality Traits]

Competitor Positioning:
[How You Want to Differ]

Existing Examples:
[Links or Descriptions of Current Content]

NZ Brand Considerations:
[Local Cultural Elements]

Create guidelines covering:
1. Brand personality definition
2. Tone of voice spectrum
3. Language do's and don'ts
4. NZ English conventions
5. Channel-specific adaptations
6. Example copy for different scenarios
7. Words to use and avoid
8. Cultural sensitivity notes
